snippet: LEAD: On his second political foray into California in less than a month, President Bush cut a ribbon at a new prison today to show how tough Republicans are on crime, but he found a fast-growing state in political upheaval with a disoriented Repu...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: On his second political foray into California in less than a month, President Bush cut a ribbon at a new prison today to show how tough Republicans are on crime, but he found a fast-growing state in political upheaval with a disoriented Republican Party.

headline.main: In California, Bush Tries to Close Gap With Troubled G.O.P.

byline.original: By ROBERT REINHOLD, Special to The New York Times
